questions.question_text: A customer's call center unexpectedly moved from in-person to remote operations and discovered that agents could no longer record their calls. The customer escalates this problem to their Customer Success Manager and requests a resolution. The Customer Success Manager recognizes that the customer is using collaboration products with outdated software. What is the first step of the mitigation plan?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: B
I would go for B and directly involve a specialist, e.g. via TAC SR. Business impact is clear, evaluating resources looks like useless hesitation.
why not workaround as immediate mitigation plan?

Selected Answer: A
No need for an asssesment. Source of the problem is clear, needs a software update. So look for availble resources

choices.D: Establish a timeline of when a solution must be in place.
choices.C: Conduct an assessment of the business impact of the problem.
choices.B: Engage a specialist to identify a technical solution or workaround.
choices.A: Evaluate the availability of resources to work on the problem.

discussion.content: Training course said it is subscription economy
B. subscription economy
B subscription economy - answer is from Cisco course

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer.

Hi Guys, answer A, because regarding why do they want subscription economy? 60% Flexibility, 50% Smaller up-front investement, 45% reduction in total cost. Most part of the trend are financial reasons

Selected Answer: B
B, subscription economy
B Correct
Hi Just need to some advice on this question, you say its subscription economy was this on the cisco Course, I am stuck between A or B - can someone advise on this
Subscription economy

questions.question_text: What is a key driver that is creating the need for customer success?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
What is the first step should take? Not only the first step but the most logical. The question is Why was the solution purchased? The customer knows this. They bought it. Why would you do anything else?

My answer would be A. The first step a Customer Success Manager (CSM) should take to identify why the solution was purchased is to engage with the customer. By directly interacting with the customer, the CSM can gain insights into their needs, expectations, and motivations for choosing the solution. Understanding the customerâ€™s perspective is crucial for effective customer success management.
I got this question in my exam. But the selection answer are difference. I chosen answer close to 'communicate with customer'.

Selected Answer: D
Some characteristics of a customer success plan are as follows:
It is a tool for documenting the alignment of priorities concerning the who, what, and why of customer purchases.

comments.content: CSM should identify why the solution was purchased. So he check it in the doc he wrote? He has a split personality?

discussion.content: should be D

questions.question_text: What is the first step a Customer Success Manager should take to identify why the solution was purchased?

Reducing CO2 footprint can result into tax credits and incentives, improved efficiency, healthier workplaces, and cost savings, meaning more money to sustain your business longer.

questions.question_text: The customer wants to improve operational expenditure and reduce the C02 footprint of the organization. Which two business outcomes are critical to the company's success? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Keep services as a primary topic
